definition: to beat/to flog/to examine under torture

sentences.english: "It was a torture room, " Kamel says.
sentences.chinese: 这曾是一间拷问房”卡迈尔说著。

sentences.english: I was taken to a chamber for sweating.
sentences.chinese: 我被带到了刑讯室去进行拷问。

sentences.english: We grasped small monster petticoat detailed increase to cross-examine, can certainly ask a why.
sentences.chinese: 咱们抓了小妖女详加拷问，定能问出个所以然来。

sentences.english: We grilled Microsoft to get the low down on the new OS release
sentences.chinese: 拷问微软，新操系统究竟有什么。

sentences.english: Students spoke of torture and mistreatment.
sentences.chinese: 学生们谈起当时遭受的拷问和虐待。

sentences.english: Chen angry, let a person find the leading sunspot, torture.
sentences.chinese: 陈大恼羞成怒，让人找到领头的黑子，严刑拷问。

sentences.english: We can put the enemy soldier to the question if he doesn't want to tell the truth.

definition: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to flog/to lash/to whip/to urge or goad along
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
